comment._content: Awesome image !! Horse back is the best transportation !!

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: Is that a Shetland pony or just a pony?

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content:
We've identified this photo -or rather, our friends at the Kilcoy Historical Society have. "It is Mr Edwin Randall on horseback, Monsildale Road, Sheep Station Creek, via Kilcoy . He and wife Jane selected Portion 107  26 September 1887. It is thought the house was one of the first sawn timber houses built in the Sheep Station Creek area." 

Our thanks to Noela Lowien - Research and publishing officer for Kilcoy District Historical Society.
